name: Campaign question
text: Hello {{name}}. Thank you for using our services. This is the satisfaction survey. Please rate you satisfaction level from 1 to 6 where 1 means that you not satisfied and 6 means that you are fully satisfied.

name: Campaign greetings
text: Thank you for your answer. Have a nice day.

name: Welcome message
text: Welcome to the Automat Berlin sample flow

name: Gather message
text: For Automat Berlin sales press 1, for Automat Berlin engineering press 2

name: Weather message
text: Welcome to the weather information service. Please provide postal code of the city in Germany to hear the information about current temperature in this city.

name: Current weather
text: Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.

template:
Campaign Report

{{#payload}} {{/payload}}
Phone Name Call Status Input
{{Phone}} {{Name}} {{CallStatus}} {{Input}}

name: SET ENV VARS!
prepare SQL statements
Setup instructions
info:
### MongoDB database (default)

MongoDB database is provided out-of-the-box as mLab MongoDB add-on on Heroku (https://elements.heroku.com/addons/mongolab).

There is no configuration needed unless you would like to change something.

You can browse MongoDB collections from your Heroku account via browser or by connecting to the database.

### MySQL database (skip if not needed)

Before using the flow prepare MySQL database if you are going to use it for storing the report. 
On Heroku you can use ClearDB add-on (https://elements.heroku.com/addons/cleardb). Remember to install it before using the flow to not lose your configuration after dyno is restarted.

Create empty database using following SQL statement:

```
create table reports (
   id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT,
   phone VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   call_status VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   input VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
   PRIMARY KEY (id)
);
```

Set database connection details in `MySQL database` node and connect it to the `prepare data` node.

### Twilio configuration

Set environment variables in `SET ENV VARS!` node.

Then, click `PREPARE CAMPAIGN` to export variables to the flow.

### CSV data

Before staring a campaign, connect `START CAMPAIGN` node with:
 - `CSV contents` template node if you want to provide data inside,
 - `get CSV file from URL` http request node if you want to get data from external URL.

For `CSV contents` please update template with your test numbers.

### Running a campaign

To run a campaign click the button of `START CAMPAIGN` node.

### Generating reports

Generated reports can be found at URLs relative to the host of your deployment:
 - `/report.csv`
 - `/report.html`
and in MySQL database in `reports` table (if it was configured).

You can also check the output logged in Debug window on the right side.

name: Setup instructions
info:
Complete following steps before using sample flow.

 * Set Twilio Account SID and Auth token in account configuration in `hangup-call` node.
 * Set phone number in `dial sales` node.
 * Set phone number in `dial engineering` node.

name: Setup instructions
info:
Complete following steps before using weather flow.

 * Create account at https://openweathermap.org and generate the API key.
 * Set API key in `prepare request` function nodes.
 * Set API key in `Weather provider` configuration of `current-weather` node.
 * Go to your Twilio account and configure chosen webhook.

To test the flow use existing postal code in Germany, e.g. 12524 for Berlin.

name: prepare request
process request
<Say> template
template:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Response>
    <Say voice="alice" language="en-US">Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.</Say>
</Response>

name: prepare request
process request
<Message> template
template:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Response>
    <Message>
        <Body>Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.</Body>
    </Message>
</Response>

text: Today there is going to be {{payload.temp}} degree(s) Celsius in {{payload.cityName}}.
